definitions.definition: resist an attack made on (someone or something); protect from harm or danger.
examples: we shall defend our country, whatever the cost
synonyms: watch over "a fort built to defend the border"

definitions.definition: speak or write in favor of (an action or person); attempt to justify.
examples: he defended his policy of imposing high taxes
synonyms: endorse; informalthrow one's weight behind "the manager defended his players"

definitions.definition: conduct the case for (the party being accused or sued) in a lawsuit.
examples: the lawyer had defended the dissidents

definitions.definition: compete to retain (a title or seat) in a contest or election.
examples: he successfully defended his congressional seat in new elections

definitions.definition: (in sports) protect one's goal rather than attempt to score against one's opponents.
